isv.sap.payment.addon.handler

Interface ResponseHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultIsvResponseHandler

    public interface ResponseHandler
    Interface defines various methods to check on isv response.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getValidParameters(HttpServletRequest request)
      This method creates a map containing only signed parameters from the request + the signature.
      boolean isDecisionSuccessful(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse) 
      boolean isValidSignature(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse) 
      void processResponse(AbstractOrderModel order, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse)
      Processes isv response and creates order payment transactions.

    • Method Detail

      • getValidParameters

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getValidParameters(HttpServletRequest request)
        This method creates a map containing only signed parameters from the request + the signature. All methods working with SOP/HOP responses should rely ONLY on the parameters returned here otherwise the application will be vulnerable to attacks.
        Parameters:
        request - SOP/HOP request
        Returns:
        Map containing the signed request parameters + the signature

      • processResponse

        void processResponse(AbstractOrderModel order,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse)
        Processes isv response and creates order payment transactions.
        Parameters:
        order - the order
        paymentResponse - the payment response data

      • isValidSignature

        boolean isValidSignature(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse)
        Parameters:
        paymentResponse - Map containing the signed fields from the request. This map should be the output from getValidParameters
        Returns:
        true/false indicating if the parameters have a valid signature. If the signature is not valid, the order should not be processed

      • isDecisionSuccessful

        boolean isDecisionSuccessful(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse)
        Parameters:
        paymentResponse - the payment response data
        Returns:
        Indicates if the authorization for the payment was successful or not
